page.title: 09Manor Houses in Bramdean
page.content: BRAMDEAN MANOR. Built in 1740, listed grade 2. Bow fronted windows added in 1840. It has four bricked up windows due to window tax. WOODCOTE MANOR.The original building was 12th century but nothing remains of this. The earliest part remaining is 15th century, added to in 17th century and finally a fine hall built and designed by Blomfield in 1911. There are four barns, one of which is a staddle stone granary, and a gabled coach house, all dating from 17th century. BRAMDEAN HOUSE. Probably built in 18th century with additions in 19th and 20th century. It has a magnificent garden which dates from 1750. BROCKWOOD PARK.Built in 18th century when it was called the Leys. It has beautiful parkland which has very rare species of trees, some planted in 1791
